column1: Kata Robata////Had a phenomenal meal here a few days ago. We opted for the "omakase" (which means a meal consisting of dishes selected by the chef - so whatever is the freshest and best that day). I can't even begin to describe how delicate
column2: yet flavorful each of the dishes were. Each piece of sushi just melted in your mouth like butter. Even the rice was the perfect texture - firm enough to dip in soy sauce without falling apart and seasoned perfectly. Our dessert was out of this world - a Japanese style "cheesecake"
column3: but no ordinary cheesecake. It was pillowy soft
column5: and reminded me of the many trips I've taken to Japan. In fact
column6: this whole experience made me feel like I was in Japan.
